summary: Build a romantic multi-page Valentine proposal website (single HTML/CSS/JS) with animated hearts, memory photo section, and interactive YES/NO buttons with confetti celebration.
architectural_notes: Implement as a single static HTML file with embedded CSS and vanilla JS controlling page navigation and animations (floating hearts via interval, confetti on YES).
Remove the Memories image upload UI/logic; use fixed (hardcoded/configured) image sources for the memory cards.
Treat the currently selected/user-added Memories images as the new fixed static assets so they persist across reloads (no upload/localStorage-based replacement).
known_issues: Deployment failed; user requested to undo the last step and redeploy.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page React view that reproduces the provided 5-step Valentine proposal flow using in-app state (no full page reloads): Page 1 (Attention), Page 2 (Hello), Page 3 (Memories), Page 4 (Letter), Page 5 (Valentine question). Only one page/step is visible at a time, with clear navigation via the same button actions as the HTML (e.g., ‚ÄúEnter at your own risk‚Äù, ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù, etc.). All user-facing text must be in English (matching the provided copy).

Implement the floating hearts background animation equivalent to the provided HTML/JS: continuously spawn heart elements at random horizontal positions and sizes, animate them from bottom to top while fading out, and remove them after the animation duration. Ensure the animation does not block interaction with page content and performs smoothly on mobile and desktop.

Implement the Memories step (Page 3) with three memory cards that each show an image and a caption, using the same three image URLs currently in the provided HTML: https://via.placeholder.com/300x200 (three times). Keep the images responsive and rounded similarly to the provided CSS.

I already told my friends üò≠‚Äù.

Apply a cohesive romantic visual theme across all steps inspired by the provided HTML styling: a pink/rose gradient background, centered content, rounded buttons with hover scaling, and accessible typography sizing that adapts to mobile (similar to the clamp-based sizes shown). Do not use a blue/purple primary theme.
